newsitem.title: SLOVAKIA: Slovak SAX boosted by VSZ, market still illiquid.
newsitem.headline: Slovak SAX boosted by VSZ, market still illiquid.

text.p: Slovakia's Bratislava Stock Exchange (BSE) limped through another quiet session on Thursday, with gains to steel maker VSZ pushing the SAX index up 1.78 points to 170.47.
VSZ steel closed up 10 crowns at 650, on trade of 4,201 shares, the largest volume on the BSE floor.
Brokers remained sceptical, saying the trade appears to be random, without any new trend on the generally illiquid market.
Other blue chips traded only insignificant volumes or, such as the oil refinery Slovnaft and oil and gas storage Nafta did not match even a single share.
Overall volume decreased to 773,887 shares, from 1,233,184 shares on Wednesday, while turnover fell to 487.63 million crowns from 900.11 million.
Both volume and turnover were boosted by direct trades.
